member.name: M:FinanceManager.Infrastructure.Notifications.InMemoryHolidayProvider.IsPublicHoliday(System.DateTime,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified local date is a public holiday for the given country (and optional subdivision).
member.param: The local date to check.
The ISO country code (e.g. "DE", "US"). When null or whitespace the method returns false.
Optional subdivision code (state/province). Currently ignored by the default in-memory provider.
member.returns: true when the date is considered a public holiday for the specified country; otherwise false.
member.remarks: The provider caches computed holiday sets per (country, year) for 12 hours. The current implementation only contains a minimal set of fixed-date holidays and does not implement moveable feasts or country-specific weekend rules. Extend or replace this provider with an external API (e.g. Nager.Date) for production scenarios.

member.name: T:FinanceManager.Infrastructure.Notifications.NagerDateHolidayProvider
member.summary: Provider using the Nager.Date public holidays API (https://date.nager.at) to determine public holidays. Caches fetched year maps in-memory for efficiency. Supports country-wide and regional (county) holidays.

member.name: F:FinanceManager.Infrastructure.Notifications.NagerDateHolidayProvider._cache
member.summary: Local in-memory cache used to store holiday maps per country/year. Entries are cached for 12 hours.

member.summary: Extracts lines of text and table rows from the specified PDF file content, returning each non-empty line as a string.
member.remarks: The extraction respects the current parsing mode, which determines whether text, tables, or both are included. Lines are separated based on their position and orientation within the PDF. Table rows are returned as pipe-delimited strings when applicable.
member.returns: An enumerable collection of strings, each representing a non-empty line or table row extracted from the PDF. The collection will be empty if no content is found.

member.name: M:FinanceManager.Infrastructure.Statements.Files.TextStatementFile.Load(System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Attempts to load the specified file as a text-based file, validating that the provided bytes represent a supported text encoding.
member.remarks: This method checks for common text file encodings, including UTF-8 and UTF-16 with or without a byte order mark (BOM), and rejects files containing embedded NUL bytes or invalid UTF-8 sequences. Files that do not meet these criteria are not loaded as text and the method returns false. The method will additionally attempt several legacy code pages (e.g. Windows-1252) and choose the first encoding that round-trips the bytes without loss.
member.param: The original filename of the statement file (used for logging or metadata). May be null or empty.
The contents of the file to load, as a byte array. Must not be null or empty.
member.returns: true if the file is recognized as a supported text format and loaded successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:FinanceManager.Infrastructure.Statements.Files.TextStatementFile.ReadContent
member.summary: Reads the content of a text file using the previously detected encoding and returns its lines as a sequence of strings.
member.remarks: Line breaks are recognized as either '\r\n' or '\n'. The method does not trim whitespace from lines or filter out empty lines.
member.returns: An enumerable collection of strings, each representing a line from the decoded file content. The collection will be empty if the file contains no lines.

member.name: T:FinanceManager.Infrastructure.Statements.Parsers.DoubleToleranceComparer
member.summary: Provides an equality comparer for double-precision floating-point values that considers two values equal if they differ by no more than a specified tolerance.
member.remarks: Use this comparer to perform equality checks on double values where exact equality is not appropriate due to the imprecision of floating-point arithmetic. The comparer is suitable for scenarios such as unit testing or collections where approximate equality is required. All values are considered to have the same hash code, which may affect the performance of hash-based collections such as dictionaries or hash sets.

member.name: M:FinanceManager.Infrastructure.Statements.Parsers.DoubleToleranceComparer.#ctor(System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DoubleToleranceComparer class with the specified comparison tolerance.
member.remarks: Use this constructor to define the precision used when comparing double values for equality. A smaller tolerance results in stricter comparisons.
member.param: The maximum difference between two double values for them to be considered equal. Must be greater than or equal to 0.

member.name: M:FinanceManager.Infrastructure.Statements.Parsers.DoubleToleranceComparer.Equals(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Determines whether two double-precision floating-point numbers are equal within a specified tolerance.
member.remarks: Use this method to compare double values for equality when exact matches are unreliable due to floating-point precision errors. The tolerance value is defined by the instance and affects the comparison result.
member.param: The first double-precision floating-point number to compare.
The second double-precision floating-point number to compare.
member.returns: true if the absolute difference between x and y is less than or equal to the configured tolerance; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:FinanceManager.Infrastructure.Statements.Parsers.DoubleToleranceComparer.GetHashCode(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns a hash code for the specified double-precision floating-point value.
member.remarks: This implementation always returns 0, which forces equality comparisons to rely solely on the Equals method. As a result, using this comparer in hash-based collections may lead to performance degradation due to hash collisions.
member.param: The double-precision floating-point value for which to get a hash code.
member.returns: A hash code for the specified value.

member.summary: Wendet die Mindestanzahl-Regel auf monatliche (nicht weiter gesplittete) Gruppen an. Strategien (aus Tests abgeleitet): 1. Fhrende kleine Monate vor erstem groen: in Blcken >= Min bndeln; Rest mit erstem groen Monat mergen. 2. Kleine Monate am Ende analog (wenn eigenstndiger Block >= Min bildbar, separat lassen; sonst mit letztem groen mergen). 3. Einzelner kleiner Monat zwischen zwei groen -> an rechten groen hngen (Test {20,3,20} -> {20,23}). 4. Mehrere kleine Monate zwischen zwei groen -> balanciert verteilen, indem immer die aktuell kleinere Seite den nchsten kleinen Monat bernimmt (Test {19,1,1,19} -> {20,20}). 5. Reine Sequenz nur kleiner Monate -> greedy Blcke bilden bis >= Min, letzter evtl. kleiner Block mit vorigem mergen. 6. Folge kleiner Monate vor groem Monatsblock: Baue mglichst Blcke exakt = Min (Test 1,1,1,1,1,1,20 Min=5 -> {5,21}).

member.summary: Imports a backup stream for the specified user. The backup format is newline-delimited NDJSON: first line contains metadata, remaining data contains JSON payload. Supports multiple backup versions; higher versions are preferred when available.
member.param: The owner user id for which data should be imported.
Stream containing the backup data (will be read but not disposed by this method).
When true, existing user data is cleared before importing.
Cancellation token to cancel the import operation.

member.exception: Thrown when the provided stream does not contain valid backup metadata or unsupported version.
